et seq electrical code adopted the national electrical edition as published by the national fire protection association be and is hereby adopted as the electrical code of the village of bourbonnais and is hereby amended explained and supplemented as hereinafter set forth for the control and safeguarding of persons and property from hazards arising from the use of electricity  and each and all of the regulations of the national electrical edition are hereby referred to adopted and made a part of this section as if fully set out in this section when any provisions of the national electrical edition conflict with the provisions of this chapter the provisions of this chapter shall control furthermore this chapter provides for penalties and enforcement provisions which shall apply to any violations or requirements of the national electrical edition in general pt 1 3491 permits a permits issued by the building department shall be required of all persons performing or contracting to have done any electrical work within the confines of this village such work shall include wiring of singlefamily residential multifamily commercial and industrial buildings garages and storage sheds or work shops permits shall be required for the installation of tv cable exterior lighting telephone sign warning alarm and security systems and shall be in the possession of such persons before any work is begun violators of this stipulation shall be subject to citation and penalties as outlined in section 94 of this chapter b permits shall be issued to qualified homeowners who intend to perform their own electrical work such homeowners shall indicate their intention and so state on the permit form provided the permit shall be issued to allow them to do electrical work on their own property excluding multifamily units and they shall follow all provisions of the electrical code such work shall be subject to the inspection and approval of the electrical inspector when the work is to be done by the owner the permit shall so state and shall bear the signature of said owner c a qualified homeowner shall be one who can by his performance demonstrate his ability to properly perform such work to the reasonable satisfaction of the electrical inspector failure to do so shall culminate in the denial of that privilege and he shall be required to employ a qualified tradesman or contractor to complete the job d permits shall be issued to those persons qualified registered and insured as electrical contractors who may be under contract to perform a given work and the permit shall be issued by the electrical inspector or his designated assistant and shall bear the signature of the person or persons responsible for its completion pt 1 3491 registration of contractors a it shall be required of every electrical contractor working within the village of bourbonnais to be registered with the village building department b all persons andor agents of that person who are not electrical contractors and wish to do electrical work in this jurisdiction shall be registered with the building department before their work begins they shall be required to show proof of their qualification to perform in that capacity to the reasonable satisfaction of the electrical inspector and their signature shall appear on the electrical permit pt 1 3491 penalties any person who violates any provision of this chapter shall be subject to a fine of $5000 for the first day of offense and $10000 for each subsequent day of offense thereafter each day that such violation continues unassuaged shall be deemed a separate offense and shall be charged cumulatively pt 1 3491 electrical inspection department a creation composition there is hereby created the department of electrical inspection the duties of said department to be performed by the member or members thereof composed of a chief electrical inspector and any number of assistant electrical inspectors who shall be appointed by the president with the advice and consent of the board of trustees b powers and duties it shall be the duty of the chief electrical inspector and the assistant electrical inspectors to enforce all of the regulations outlined in this chapter and in the current national electrical hereinafter referred to as the nec the electrical inspectors shall have full authority to modify or waive said regulations by giving special permission in particular cases where such action shall be advisable prudent or in the best interests of the village such special permission shall be made in a charge order form signed by both parties prior to the commencement of the work and a copy kept on file in the building department c compensation supervision of personnel the compensation of the chief electrical inspector and such assistant electrical inspectors as from time to time may be appointed shall be fixed by resolution of the president and the board of trustees the assistant electrical inspectors shall be under the supervision of the chief electrical inspector pt 1 3491 electrical commission there shall be an electrical commission consisting of six members as follows the chief electrical inspector shall be a member and ex officio chairman of the commission  of the other five members one shall be a registered professional engineer one an electrical contractor one a journeyman electrician one a representative of an inspection bureau maintained by the fire underwriters if such a representative resides in the municipality and if no such representative resides in the municipality then the chief of the fire department and one representative of an electricity supply company if there is no person residing in the municipality who is qualified under any one of these descriptions the president may appoint some other person to fill that position all members of the electrical commission shall be appointed by the president with the advice and consent of the corporate authorities pt 1 3491 administration a responsibility and liability the electrical regulations of this code shall not be construed to relieve from or lessen the responsibility of any person owning operating selling offering for sale or installing any electrical wires apparatus appliance or equipment for damages to anyone injured by any defect therein by reason of the inspection authorized herein or the certificate of inspection issued by the building department or the electrical inspectors nor shall the village of bourbonnais be held liable for any damages resulting from the enforcement of the regulations of this code the electrical inspectors shall not be liable for any problems arising out of any electrical installation which he may have inspected upon the completion of any project which he has approved the contractor or electrical practitioner responsible for such work shall sign a certificate of completion and shall be held responsible for any ensuing disaster which might occur b notification of progress for inspection it shall be incumbent upon the permit holder that person to whom the permit is issued or the registered contractor andor agent performing the work to inform the building department that a job has progressed to a point requiring inspection points of inspection are i upon the completion of the installation of a service entrance on a building or structure  ii upon the completion of that stage of development known as the rough in  and iii upon the completion of the entire electrical installation and prior to assuming occupancy or utilization of the premises c authority to enter buildings the electrical inspectors are hereby authorized to enter any building or premises occupied or vacant at any reasonable hour in the discharge of his duties it shall be competent for them when deemed to be necessary to remove or cause to be removed any existing obstruction such as laths plaster board wall board partitions or siding which may prevent a completion inspection of the electrical equipment in question they shall be authorized to enter any building used in whole or in part for the purpose of public assemblage at any time when occupied by the public in order to examine electrical equipment in such building it shall be unlawful for any person to interfere with an inspector in the performance of his duties d right of entry pm 1044 of boca code 1990 if any owner occupant or other person in charge of a structure subject to the provisions of this code refuses impedes inhibits interferes with restricts or obstructs entry and free access to any part of the structure or premises where inspection authorized by this code is sought the administrative authority shall be permitted to seek in a court of competent jurisdiction an order that such owner occupant or other person in charge cease and desist with such interference e authority to stop work no electrical conduit wires equipment or apparatus shall be installed in any building or structure for which a permit is required until such permit shall have been secured any such installations made prior to having procured a proper permit for same shall be a violation of the electrical regulations of this code and of this village and the electrical inspectors shall have the power to stop all such work at once and to order any and all persons engaged therein to stop and desist therefrom until proper permit has been secured failure to comply with such order of an electrical inspector shall be a violation of the code and shall merit a citation for noncompliance with these regulations violation shall be subject to penalties as outlined in section 94 of this chapter a stop work order shall also be enforceable by application to the circuit court for an order of injunction f notices and seals the electrical inspectors are hereby empowered to attach to cabinets equipment or structures any official notice or seal to prevent the use of electricity or premises it shall be unlawful for any other person to put or attach such seal or to break change destroy tear mutilate cover or otherwise deface or injure any such official notice or seal posted by an electrical inspector penalties for such violation shall be as outlined in section 94 of this chapter g certificate of occupancy 1 a certificate of occupancy shall be required before any owner agent proprietor landlord or tenant shall be allowed to inhabit or utilize any structure or premises while it remains under the consideration and scrutiny of the building department premises under construction shall be deemed construction sites under the law and shall be subject to applicable regulations said sites shall remain construction sites until certified by the building department having been finally inspected and approved to be ready for occupancy andor utilization 2 no premises residential or commercial shall be occupied until a certificate of occupancy has been issued by the building department signifying the legal safe and satisfactory completion of the work undertaken to assure the health and welfare of any and all occupants thereof pt 1 3491 approved equipment and installation methods a only those electrical equipments appliances and devices which are listed and approved for use by underwriters laboratories canadian standards association c s a or other necapproved testing agency shall be installed in the village of bourbonnais b b of the nec shall be amended to include the following exception aluminum or copperclad aluminum wire shall not be used for any wiring in the village of bourbonnais the conditions set forth in this chapter shall apply from the point where the source of public power is connected to the service entrance conductors and throughout the entire succeeding structure or structures c where rework or rewiring of any building or structure of 50 percent or more then all wiring shall be made code complaint d all service entrance systems installed in this jurisdiction shall be installed by electrical contractors registered with the building department violators of this section shall be subject to a fine as outlined in section 94 of this chapter e all service entrances shall be made in accordance with the specifications as outlined in the current nec article 230 with the exception of item 5 se or use cable 11 mc cable 12 mineralinsulated or metalsheathed cable shall not be used as a service entrance f all overheadtype service entrance installations shall use rigid or intermediate metal conduit imc or rigid aluminum conduit as the riser from the meter socket to the weather head service entrance installation shall be made in a workmanlike manner and firmly attached to the building or structure it is designed to serve g no service entrance shall be installed on any buildings within the village limits which is smaller than 100amp capacity without the specific approval and permission of the electrical inspectors such approval shall be governed by the amperage requirements of that particular application a 100amp service entrance conduit shall be a minimum of one and onefourth inch diameter rigid pipe the service conductors shall be three #3 copper thhn conductors a 200amp service entrance conduit shall be not less than one and onehalf inch diameter rigid pipe and shall have three #30 copper thhn conductors 1 in cases where the service riser is intended to serve as the sole support of the service drop it shall be per the commonwealth edison requirements for the supply of electrical service  ie rigid steel conduit two and onehalf inch for 100amp or smaller or three inch for larger service entrance 2 all electrical distribution panels shall be fed in conduit from the metering source 3 no distribution panel shall be installed in any closet where working space is limited or where combustible materials are stored in hazardous proximity 4 electrical distribution panels using plug fuses for circuit interrupters shall not be approved for use in this village to protect more than two circuits this is not intended to prevent the use of fused disconnects as a disconnect means for specific appliances h grounding and bonding  1 all parts of the service entrance system raceways pipe at both ends and enclosures shall be effectively bonded to the grounding electrode see articles 23063 and 250b the grounding conductor shall be firmly landed in each enclosure concentric or eccentric knockouts shall not be considered to be adequate to affect acceptable bonding unless the maximum knockout is being used for the raceway fitting in which case a solid locknut will be used both inside and outside of the enclosure to assure bonding see article 25072 c d and e where a lessor lesser knockout is used a lock nut shall be used on the outside of the enclosure and a bonding bushing will be required on the inside with a jumper to the enclosure to affect continuity to ground all fittings are to be made up wrench tight 2 in residential wiring a grounding electrode ground rod shall be installed and the grounding electrode conductor from the meter socket to the grounding electrode shall be firmly attached to the building or structure it is designed to serve for 100amp service no grounding conductor smaller than no 6 awg shall be used for this application and it is required that it be sheathed for protection as described in paragraph 3 below for 200amp service no grounding conductor smaller than no 4 awg shall be used it shall not be required to sheath a #4 conductor but it shall be firmly attached to the building for protection against possible injury or damage the current nec shall determine the conductor size in all cases 3 if it is elected that the ground electrode conductor be protected by electrical metallic tubing emt it shall be firmly attached to the meter socket and to the building or structure to guard against accidental damage both ends of this emt shall be bonded to the grounding conductor by nec approved methods exception a straight length of nonmetallic tubing pvc which may or may not be attached to the meter socket is acceptable for this purpose but it too will be required to be firmly mounted to the building or structure it is intended to serve 4 all grounding conductors and the grounding electrode conductor shall be effectively connected to the metal cold water piping system to the extent that such piping exists 5 approved grounding clamps shall be used to install a bonding jumper of not smaller than no 6 copper around the water meter it shall be of sufficient length to allow the removal of said meter without disconnecting the jumper 6 all equipment grounding conductors shall be copper 7 c1 shall be amended for the purposes of this chapter and galvanized rod or pipe shall not be used for grounding electrodes i reserved  j wiring and wiring systems  1 wire used for 120v wiring in the village of bourbonnais shall be #12 awg or heavier including switch legs 2 nm wire romex used in any building or structure where it is approved shall be installed using the methods set forth in article 3361 exception 1 article 3364 as amended by these ordinances 2 article 33612 deleted 3 article 33616 deleted of the current nec and shall have the grounding conductor carried within the sheath with the circuit conductors 3 nm romex wire shall be approved for the purpose of wiring singlefamily residences of elevations not to exceed three stories a trilevel being considered to be a threestory house for the purposes of this application the first floor being 50 percent above grade at a point six feet away from the foundation wall 4 nm wire shall be acceptable for wiring in multifamily attached structures when all units are one story elevations on basements or crawl spaces and are separated by appropriate fire rated party walls 5 nm wire shall not be permitted to be used as exposed work except as provided for in this chapter 6 nm wire shall not be used in the construction of single family dwellings which are stacked  where one dwelling is above another  or attached to similar dwelling structures separated by properly fire rated party walls multifamily buildings condominium or apartment styles shall be wired in conduit  electrical metallic tubing 7 in any case where the wiring from one apartment or dwelling must penetrate the party wall of another that point of penetration shall be firmly caulked to seal against the passage of gases vapors or fire 8 all junction boxes intended to accommodate more than two pairs of conductors and one or more devices shall be the four inch box 44112cap 9 #12 conductors designed to be 10 capped with a plaster ring gem boxes 322cap 4 #12 conductors may be ganged to accommodate multiple controlling devices 9 all buildings or parts of buildings which serve a commercial or industrial enterprise shall be required to be wired in conduit all residences located in buildings being used for commercial or industrial purposes shall also be wired in conduit 10 flat conductor cable fcc shall not be used in any construction without the written permission of the electrical inspector 11 armored cable bx shall not be used in any construction of the nec is eliminated for purposes of this section 12 flexible metal tubing fmt may be used in concealed work in dry locations where it is fished in existing walls or in partitions where it is not possible to install conduit emt or other approved raceway fmt larger than one and onefourth inches in diameter or exceeding six feet in length shall be required to carry a ground wire 13 fmt shall not be allowed in new partitions or existing partitions where the exterior finish of the wall or partitions has been removed for remodeling it shall not be approved for use in new construction or exposed work 14 emt shall not be used underground outside exposed to the weather on outside walls on roofs exposed to permanent moisture in concrete slabs or in contact with earth or fill where during installation or afterward it will be subject to mechanical injury the use of plastic or visqueen or similar materials placed under or over the tubing shall be considered the same as earth or fill 15 shall be amended to include the following holes bored ceiling joints for the purpose of creating a wire way for nm wire shall be so located that the openings are not less than two inches above the lowest edge of said joist 16 wires installed so as to run on the longitudinal axis of the wide side of any stud shall be stapled as nearly as possible to the centerline of the stud staples sufficient in number shall be driven to a depth sufficient to affect control of the wire and to prevent any damage to the conductors throughout the length of its installation 17 wires necessarily run areas shall be so located as to leave an open area in the most physically accessible part of the attic which shall be not less than eight feet generally four feet on either side of a line under and parallel to the roof ridge member the purpose for this rule is to protect such wiring from possible damage by the occupant who may choose to put down flooring or to otherwise utilize that area for storage 18 when wiring with nm romex the use of the crawl space area as a wire chase or wireway shall be avoided the load side wiring or home run shall not be installed in the crawl space without a special variance from the inspector in the jurisdiction before it is installed all wire runs shall be made along lateral and longitudinal axis of the building or structure wiring run on diagonal orientations will be rejected it shall be allowed to run nm in a crawl space to subtend some otherwise impossible structural corner treatment 19 an exception to the above article shall be that se wire may be used and run in a crawl space to add an electric dryer or air conditioner to an existing residence it shall be run in a protected and controlled manner and run in a parallel andor perpendicular orientation to existing structural members 20 all lowvoltage wiring sound or telephone indicator feeds or computer or cash register bell or warning wiring or cable tv antenna wiring shall not be run in such a way as to be supported by any suspended ceiling it shall follow the same axes of the building or structure as other wiring in the system and be supported and controlled by sufficient means  insulated staples or other fasteners designed for such purposes 21 in a commercial application wiring described in subsection 17 above shall be run in emt when run in vertical walls 22 in residential application tv coaxial cable shall not be run on the surface of the ground but shall be buried in the earth at a depth of not less than six inches 23 in all commercial construction places where public assembly is encouraged or is a condition of operation it shall be required in but not limited to hotels motels lounges taverns offices waiting rooms or any areas of similar treatment wiring of fire alarms smoke detectors and emergency lighting shall be run entirely in conduit splices and terminations shall be made in listed enclosures using appropriate listed fittings flexible conduit greenfield used in this application shall not be longer than two feet 24 all accessible lowvoltage systems such as warning systems nurses call stations bell and buzzer systems may be installed in a workmanlike manner using plenumrated cable sized per the manufacturers recommendations in new work such wiring run in vertical walls shall be in conduit 25 nm electrical wiring shall not pass within six feet of any attic or storage access portal unless adequately protected from accidental damage per article 33312a and article 33613 of the nec in no case is wire to be run in the area that passes over the top of joints which may serve as support for future storage or flooring and thereby be exposed to possible accidental damage 26 in singlefamily or multifamily residences a duplex wall receptacle shall be installed in an entry passage area or hallway a hallway ten feet in length shall be provided with at least one receptacle 27 a duplex receptacle shall be installed within 18 inches of each end of a picture window opening wider than five feet 28 in multifamily buildings where a balcony is a feature one weatherproof gfci outlet shall be provided on each balcony 29 the location of light fixtures in closets shall be in accordance with the nec article 4108 and shall have enclosed light bulbs when required per that article 30 all light fixtures shall have at least one bulb in working condition for final inspection 31 the roughedin boxes for smoke detectors shall be prominently identified for the benefit of the electrical inspector one smoke detector shall be located on the ceiling outside of the bedrooms but in the sleeping area if there is more than one sleeping area the others shall be similarly protected a detector shall be located on the ceiling at the top of each stairwell one detector shall be located in the basement or utility room furnace area on the ceiling all detectors in a dwelling shall be on a single circuit and shall be so interlocked that any one alarm will actuate them all and all shall be of battery backup design 32 one or more porcelain pull chain lighting fixtures shall be provided in crawl spaces it shall not be necessary to provide protective covering for exposed light bulbs in this application 33 unfinished basement areas shall be wired in thinwall conduit emt under the specification of the current nec and any feeds entering the living quarters above shall be allowed to be fed by nm wire with not more than 18 inches exposed before entry floor above into a wall or sill 34 structures buildings basements or garages which are remodeled or revised to serve any commercial purposes shall be required to obtain proper permits for said adaptation and shall be subject to all ordinances and licensing appurtenant to their particular intended enterprise and shall be evaluated by applicable standards 35 any enterprise which tends to create conditions comparable to those described in the nec as being class 1 or 2 and division 1 or 2 shall not be allowed example sanding andor spray painting of vehicles cars or equipment  power sanding buffing and blasting sand or cob type operations but not limited to these listed see article 5004 violators shall be prosecuted as creating a noxious hostile andor explosive environment proper wiring for such enterprise shall be in conformity with the terms outlined in articles 500 501 502 503 504 511 and 516 penalties for such infractions shall be imposed in accordance with those found in section 94 of this chapter 36 any business which utilizes a pit type of operation in order to conduct the particulars of its enterprise shall be considered to be utilizing an area where vapors gases and fumes may accumulate to form a hazardous condition and that pit area shall be wired in accordance with the methods outlined to cover class 1 division 1 or class 1 division 2 conditions in article 504 of the nec or as an alternative method ventilation of such pit areas shall be such that a volume of air equivalent to six times that of the pit volume shall be circulated out of the pit every hour per article 5113 of the nec and the nfipc national latest edition for regulation and ventilation of air 37 any business which requires storage of flammable liquids or gases shall be required to make special provision for the ventilation of that area and for the drawing off of any accumulated vapors to the outside of the structure such system should be designed for the purpose and continuous so that there can be no buildup of combustible vapor to create an explosive or otherwise hazardous condition such areas shall be required to install and maintain an approved grounding system to protect against any accumulation of static charge resulting from that storage operation vessels used in the transfer of liquids from one to another shall be effectively bonded together during the act of transferring of liquid reference boca and nfpa 38 any electrical receptacles located within six feet of a sink or comparable source of water tap kitchens bathrooms the wet bar in a family room or den and laundry room area shall be protected by a ground fault circuit interrupter gfci receptacle or breaker 39 electrical receptacles in restaurants or bars that are within six feet of any sink or water source or any conductor such as metal tables or decorative metallic trim which may be in continuity with such a water source shall be ground fault protected receptacles 40 a ground fault receptacle in a residential kitchen may only protect those receptacles in that kitchen one such receptacle may control as many as four other appliance receptacles other than a refrigerator or freezer outlet in that wall but may not protect such receptacles in any other rooms adjacent to the kitchen soffitt or ceiling lights or exhaust fans shall not be fed from kitchen appliance circuits 41 a ground fault receptacle in a bathroom may be allowed to protect another receptacle in a separate bath 42 a ground fault receptacle in a garage wall can protect as many as five other receptacles within the garage and may include one outdoor weatherproof receptacle located on a common wall one receptacle in the garage which is meant to serve a refrigerator or freezer should not be ground faulted 43 it shall not be necessary to ground fault the receptacle for a garage door opener a sump pump ejector pump refrigerator freezer or a vacuum system located in a crawl space or unfinished basement it shall be necessary to ground fault all other receptacles located in an unfinished basement or crawl space 44 the sump pump receptacle shall be a single outlet rather than a duplex per article 2108a4 exc 3 45 a sump pump ejector pump furnace or heating system and laundry receptacle shall each be on an individual branch circuit of its own 46 the receptacle in a utility room dedicated to serve the washer need not be ground faulted gfci if it is located less than 32 inches from the floor so as to be inaccessible to other uses such a receptacle located in an unfinished basement or so as to be readily accessible shall be ground faulted 47 outdoor weatherproof receptacles shall be ground faulted individually when located on the outside of the wall of an attached garage it shall be permissible to protect it from the garage interior ground fault device 48 all exterior lighting fixtures shall be mounted on appropriate enclosures octagon gem or round boxes and shall be grounded any exposed boxes shall be of the weatherproof type 49 the location of any hot tub sauna or swimming facility shall be judged giving consideration to the proximity of existing electrical installations and the particulars outlined in the nec for such installations shall be enforced 50 any light fixture designed to be used as a lay in in a suspended ceiling shall not depend upon the grid system of the suspended ceiling to be its sole support but it shall be independently supported by not less than two no 10 awg wires from structural members above 51 rigid nonmetallic conduit pvc wiring systems raceways boxes flexible tubing extensions and enclosures may be incorporated in any construction installations approved rigid nonmetallic conduit may be permitted for underground branch circuits outside or under buildings or in concrete slab work underground raceways shall not be less than 18 inches below grade except in areas where they shall be covered by nonporous material such as concrete or black top rigid nonmetallic conduit shall have a ground wire run with the enclosed conductors to assure proper grounding continuity particular attention is to be given to the grounding of all devices used in such an application to assure absolute grounding continuity pt 1 3491   2 61818 emergency lighting a adequate emergency lighting of exit ways shall be installed and maintained in buildings of all types of occupancy except one and twofamily dwellings such lighting shall be of a battery backed up design that will actuate in the event of any power failure adequate lighting shall be defined as that amount of light sufficient for occupants to safely find their way to existing exits pt 1 3491 residential garages storage units and similar buildings a where more than one building or other structure is on the same property and under single electrical management each building or other structure served shall be provided with a means for disconnecting all ungrounded conductors this disconnecting switch shall be a fused enclosure if it is meant to control more than one circuit where more than one circuit is to be controlled the fused disconnect will be treated as another service panel and will require a separate ground rod and grounding conductor per article 25024 b the feeders for any additional structures as described in above may be run underground or overhead underground feeders shall be copper of sufficient amperage to serve the anticipated demand load and shall be installed in accordance with nec  and local ordinances see subsection 98b vb village of bourbonnais of this chapter c overhead feeders to such structures shall be one switch and one receptacle the garage or building shall be on a separate circuit of its own pt 1 3491 swimming pools permits for the installation of swimming pools will not be issued until the shall be classified a temporary service for the duration of the construction period or until adequate permanent electrical service can be provided to the site in no case shall a temporary service be approval and publication as provided by law  secs 11191130  reserved article iii  smoke detectors smoke detectors required a every builder of each new dwelling unit is hereby required to install approved smoke detector or detectors in each dwelling unit as hereinafter provided b every owner of each existing dwelling unit is hereby required to install approved smoke detector or detectors in each dwelling unit as hereinafter provided c a dwelling unit is defined as a singlefamily residence apartment efficiency apartment and home trailer d approved smoke detectors shall be capable of sensing visible or invisible particles of combustion and shall provide an alarm signaling device which when activated shall be clearly audible in all sleeping rooms when all intervening doors are closed e in the event the property owner wishes to purchase a smoke detector as part of the inspection process the cost of the detector shall be $1000 in addition to the $2500 inspection fee  112177   51903 violations  penalty any person firm or corporation violating any of the provisions of this article shall be deemed guilty of a misdemeanor and upon conviction shall be subject to a fine of not less than $2500 nor more than $50000 for each offense and each and every day such violation continues it shall constitute a separate offense  112177 location of smoke detectors a at least one approved smoke detector shall be installed near each sleeping area to protect each sleeping area a sleeping area is defined as an area or areas in which sleeping rooms are located where sleeping rooms are separated by other use areas excluding bathrooms and closets they shall be considered as separate areas  each requiring an approved smoke detector b at least one approved smoke detector shall be installed at the top of each stairway leading to an occupied area including the top of a stairway from a basement an occupied area includes but is not limited to a sleeping area an approved smoke detector shall be installed at a location at the top of each stairway in such a manner as to assure that rising visible or invisible particles of combustion are not obstructed in reaching the detector and that the detector intercepts rising visible or invisible particles of combustion before such particles of combustion reach an occupied sleeping area  112177 equipment all devices combinations of devices and equipment required herein shall be installed in conformance with the building code and this article and shall be approved by the fire safety inspector approved smoke detectors as required by this article shall be those listed by underwriters laboratories inc and factory mutual approved smoke detectors listed by underwriters laboratories inc and factory mutual shall be used unless the fire safety inspector subsequently finds that the equipment is hazardous or unreliable in which case the fire safety inspector may suspend or revoke an approved smoke detector the fire safety inspector may in any such case determine whether replacement of existing installation shall be required  112177 cross reference building codes adopted  746 installation in new residential occupancies smoke detectors shall be connected to the buildings electrical circuit without a disconnect wall switch and be permanently mounted to a standard electrical outlet or junction box on the ceiling in existing dwellings it is preferred that smoke detectors be wired directly to the electrical power supply  however said detectors may be powered by selfmonitored battery or operated in a plugin outlet which is fitted with a plug restrainer device provided the outlet is not controlled by any wall switch  112177 duty of builder etc to comply with this article effective upon passage and publication of  water and sewers ch 35 article i  general provisions introduction these regulations provide for the regulation of matters relative to the management of stormwater within the jurisdiction and its extraterritorial jurisdiction to provide no adverse impact on neighboring property owners its provisions include but are not limited to regulating drainage installations and improvements requiring the preservation and enhancement of certain natural environmental features requiring the installation of drainage improvements in developments regulating uses maintenance and activities in floodplains and flood hazard areas requiring permits payment of fees and assurances of completion and providing for inspections and control of work the requirements standards and specifications herein provided are in addition to any other applicable legal requirements  41612 authority a this article shall be known and may be cited as the village of bourbonnais stormwater management b the village of bourbonnais adopts this article pursuant to its authority to regulate stormwater management and govern the location width course and release of all stormwater runoff channels streams and basins in the village the statutory authority for this article is contained in 55 ilcs 551041 51042 51043 51049 510622 51063 51104 512003 515001 et seq  415 ilcs 543 the federal water pollution control act including p commonly known as the clean water act the federal register and other applicable authority all as amended from time to time  41612 purposes a to maintain and improve the quality of water impacted by the storm drainage system within the village of bourbonnais b to promote and protect the public health safety and general welfare of the citizens from the hazards of flooding c to create a set of fair and consistent standards that will facilitate desirable and sustainable development d to protect and conserve the natural resources e to preserve property values by protecting new and existing buildings and improvements to buildings from damage due to stormwater flow f to assure that new developments and redevelopments do not increase flood or drainage hazards to others or create unstable conditions susceptible to erosion g to preserve the natural characteristics of stream corridors in order to moderate flood and stormwater impacts and to protect water quality h to prevent the discharge of contaminated stormwater runoff and illicit discharges from industrial commercial residential and construction sites into the storm drainage system i to promote public awareness of the hazards involved in the improper discharge of trash yard waste lawn chemicals pet waste wastewater oil petroleum products cleaning products paint products hazardous waste sediment and other pollutants into the natural and manmade storm drainage system j to encourage recycling of used motor oil and safe disposal of other hazardous consumer products k to facilitate compliance with state and federal standards and permits by owners of construction sites within the jurisdiction l to enable the jurisdiction to comply with all current federal and state laws and regulations applicable to the national pollutant discharge elimination system npdes permitting requirements for stormwater discharges and prepare for future requirements m to prevent additional disruption of the economy and governmental services due to stormwater and flood drainage n to protect the public from the degradation of water quality on a watershed basis and enhance the quantity and quality of potable groundwater and surface water supplies o to protect the quantity and quality of wetlands p to require the design and evaluation of each site stormwater management plan to be consistent with watershed capacities q to require regular planned maintenance of stormwater management facilities r to encourage cooperation and consistency in stormwater management activities between units of government having floodplain and stormwater jurisdiction s to lessen the taxpayers burden for flood related disasters repairs to flood damaged public facilities and utilities and flood rescue and relief operations t to restrict development and building to facilities that will not adversely affect the potential for flood damage u to require appropriate and adequate provision for site runoff control especially when the land is developed with a large amount of impervious surface  41612 abbreviations the following abbreviations when used in this article shall have the designated meanings bmp  best management practices bfe construction of a new development additions or reconstruction of structures or redevelopment from the jurisdiction appropriate official the village of bourbonnais village administrator or hisher designee base flood elevation bfe the elevation shown on the flood insurance rate map for zone ae ah a1a30 ar ara arae ara1a30 arah arao that indicates the water surface elevation resulting from a flood that has a one percent chance of equaling or exceeding that level in any given year best management practices bmps refers to management practices and methods to control pollutants in stormwater bmps are of two types source controls nonstructural and treatment controls structural source controls are practices that prevent pollution by reducing potential pollutants at their source before they come into contact with stormwater treatment controls partially remove pollutants from stormwater the selection application and maintenance of bmps must be sufficient to prevent or reduce the likelihood of pollutants entering the storm drainage system buffer an area of predominately vegetated land to be left open adjacent to channels wetlands lakes ponds or other surface waters for the purpose of eliminating or minimizing adverse effects to such areas stabilizing banks reducing contaminants including sediments in stormwater that flows to such areas building official the officer or other designated authority charged with the administration and enforcement of the building codes and regulations building permit a permit issued by the jurisdiction for the construction erection or alteration of a structure or building and the related ground and surface preparation prior to and after completion of construction erection or alteration of a structure or building certify or certification formally attesting that the specific inspections and tests were performed and that such inspections and tests comply with the applicable requirements of this article channel any defined river stream creek brook natural or artificial depression ponded area onstream lake or impoundment abandoned mine flowage slough ditch conduit culvert gully ravine wash or natural or manmade drainageway that has a definite bed and bank or shoreline in or into which surface or groundwater flows either perennially or intermittently channel modification the alteration of a channel by changing the physical dimensions or materials of its bed or banks channel modification includes damming riprapping or other armoring filling widening deepening straightening relocating lining and significant removal of bottom or woody rooted vegetation clearing any activity that removes the natural vegetative ground cover commercial pertaining to any business trade industry or other activity engaged in for profit compensatory storage the nfip floodway standard in 44 cfr 603 d restricts new development from obstructing the flow of water and increasing flood heights however this provision does not address the need to maintain flood storage especially in flat areas the floodplain provides a valuable function by storing floodwaters when fill or buildings are placed in the flood fringe the flood storage areas are lost and flood heights will go up because there is less room for the floodwaters this is particularly important in smaller watersheds which respond sooner to changes in the topography one approach that may be used to address this issue is to require compensatory storage to offset any loss of flood storage capacity some communities adopt more restrictive standards that regulate the amount of fill or buildings that can displace floodwater in the flood fringe community rating system credits are available for communities that adopt compensatory storage requirements article ii  prohibited actions surface water surface water shall be allowed to travel its existing or natural course unless changes are allowed by means of a grading and drainage permit or grading and drainage plans approved by the appropriate official 70 ilcs 605art 2  41612 easements the placement of any landscaping not in compliance with the neighborhood drainage plan for a given property or any accessory building or structure swimming pool fence or any other improvement which in any way could cause an impediment to the overland flow of stormwater within said drainage easement is hereby prohibited no buildings or permanent structures including impervious surfaces may be placed wholly or in part within an easement that has been granted for drainage facilities of any type or access thereto including agricultural drainage conduit without the written approval of the appropriate official or easement holder  provided however streets sidewalks and driveways may be allowed to cross easements by the shortest possible route provided that the flow of the stormwater runoff is not obstructed and the hwl easement does not increase as a result  41612 obstruction of watercourse it shall be unlawful for any person to cause or maintain any obstruction within a watercourse or drainage facility of any type except as may be specifically authorized by this article  41612 discharge no person shall release or cause to be released into the storm drainage system any discharge that is not composed entirely of uncontaminated stormwater except as allowed in listed exemptions of this article  41612 exempted discharges the following discharges are exempt from the regulations in this article 1 water line and fire hydrant flushing 2 landscape and lawn watering 3 rising ground waters leaks of toxic or hazardous materials have not occurred unless all spilled material has been removed  41612 requirements for certain discharges a contaminated discharge notwithstanding the listed exemptions of this section any discharge shall be prohibited by this article if the discharge in question has been determined by bourbonnais public works department to be contaminated by a harmful quantity of pollutants to the storm drainage system the construction use maintenance or continued existence of illicit connections to the storm drainage system is prohibited this prohibition expressly includes without limitation illicit connections made in the past regardless of whether the connection was permissible under law or practices applicable or prevailing at the time of connection b line connect no person shall connect a line conveying sanitary sewage domestic sewage or industrial waste to the storm drainage system or allow such a connection to continue c interference no person shall interfere with best management practices bmps implemented pursuant to this article  41612 requirements of certain discharges a cleaning of paved surfaces required the owner of any paved parking lot street or drive shall clean the pavement as required to prevent the buildup and discharge of pollutants the visible buildup of mechanical fluid waste materials sediment or debris is a violation of this article paved surfaces shall be cleaned by dry sweeping wet vacuum sweeping collection and treatment of wash water or other methods in compliance with this article this section does not apply to pollutants discharged from construction activities which are otherwise specified b mobile commercial cosmetic cleaning operations mobile commercial cosmetic cleaning operations shall not discharge to the storm drainage system in violation of this article c maintenance of equipment any leak or spill related to equipment maintenance in an outdoor uncovered area shall be contained to prevent the potential release of pollutants vehicles machinery and equipment must be maintained to reduce leaking fluids d materials storage in addition to other requirements of this article materials shall be stored to prevent the potential release of pollutants the uncovered outdoor storage of unsealed containers of hazardous substances is prohibited e pet waste pet waste shall be disposed of as solid waste or sanitary sewage in a timely manner to prevent discharge to the storm drainage system f pesticides herbicides insecticides fungicides and fertilizers pesticides herbicides insecticides fungicides and fertilizers shall be applied in accordance with manufacturer recommendations and applicable laws there shall be no excessive application g prohibition on use of pesticides herbicides insecticides and fungicides banned from manufacture use of any pesticide herbicide insecticides or fungicide the manufacture of which has been either voluntarily discontinued or prohibited by the us or illinois environmental protection agency or any federal state or jurisdiction regulation is prohibited h release reporting and cleanup 1 any person responsible for a known or suspected release of materials which are resulting in or may result in illegal discharges to the storm drainage system shall take all necessary steps to ensure the discovery containment abatement and cleanup of such release 2 in the case of environmental emergencies involving oil or hazardous materials releases fish kills caused by pollutants or public water supplies immediately contact the illinois epa office of emergency response at 217 7827860 and the national response center at 800 4248802 or 202 2672675 3 this is in addition to other legal reporting requirements hazardous waste releases shall be avoided 4 village of bourbonnais may adopt and impose requirements identifying best management practices bmps for any activity operation or facility which may cause a discharge of pollutants to the storm drainage system where specific bmps are required every person undertaking such activity or operation or owning or operating such facility shall implement and maintain these bmps at their own expense  41612 secs 12181220  reserved article iii  inspections and plan modifications inspections the village shall make periodic site visits and shall notify the grading and drainage permit holder in the event that the work fails to comply with the requirements of this article the notification of any deficiencies in the work or violations of this article shall be mailed to the owner of the site and permit holder by ordinary mail failure to issue a stop work order shall not be deemed consent by the jurisdiction to continue work nor acceptance of deficiencies nor violations the owner of the site shall notify the appropriate official 1 two working days prior to the start of any land disturbing activities 2 upon the installation of sediment and runoff control measures including perimeter controls and diversions prior to proceeding with any other earth disturbance or grading 3 after stripping and clearing 4 after rough grading 5 a minimum of 24 hours notification shall be provided  prior to covering any exposed subgrade placing any fill backfilling and sanitary water or storm lines placing base course stone placing concrete or placing asphalt 6 prior to and after completing seeding and landscaping 7 after final stabilization and landscaping and prior to removal of temporary sediment controls 8 any time during construction that a field tile or any other underground drainage pipes are encountered the appropriate official shall be notified a site meeting shall be conducted with the village engineer prior to any disposition being decided the village engineer has the sole authority in determining requirements for any field tile pipe etc encountered during construction  41612 special precautions a if at any stage of the grading of any development site the village determines by site visit that the nature of the site is such that further work authorized by an existing permit is likely to imperil any property public way stream lake wetland or drainage structure the village shall require as a condition of allowing the work to be done that such reasonable special precautions be taken as is considered advisable to avoid the likelihood of such peril special precautions may include but shall not be limited to a more level exposed slope construction of additional drainage facilities berms terracing compaction cribbing installation of plant materials for erosion control andor recommendations of a registered professional engineer which may make additional requirements in order for further work b on large developments or where unusual site conditions occur the owner shall submit a schedule to be approved by the appropriate official that shall specify the starting and completion times of required activity or may require that the operations be conducted in specific stages so as to ensure completion of protective measures or devices prior to the advent of seasonal conditions c where it appears that storm damage may result because the grading on any development site is not complete work shall be stopped and the grading and drainage permit holder required to install temporary structures or take such other measures as may be required to protect adjoining property or the public safety  41612 amendment of plans any significant amendments to grading plans or stormwater pollution prevention plans shall be submitted to the appropriate official of the village and shall be processed and approved or disapproved in the same manner as the original plans any significant field modifications made without prior approval shall be a direct violation of this article  41612 record drawings upon completion of the improvements the licensed professional engineer registered in the state of illinois shall provide a set of asbuilt permit requirements of this article  6 failure to perform site visits b the village of bourbonnais shall take into account storm and flood hazards to the extent they are known or can be determined in is not responsible for work stopstart meansmethods or job safety  41612 fees there is no fee for a class 1 or class 2 grading and drainage permit  41612 fee in lieu of detention a for the purpose of provide detention or compensatory storage for the watershed or drainage basin in which the property exists the cost figures used for detention shall be actual costs for detention or compensatory storage being provided by contract or estimated costs for planned detention or compensatory storage facilities approved by the village board of trustees all revenues received fees shall be used for no detention needed in lieu of the applicant building a basin on site provided the property will discharge stormwater into existing or proposed detention facilities with added capacity for the additional runoff  41612 ownership and maintenance of drainage facilities a the village of bourbonnais will maintain those drainage facilities that are on public land and have been dedicated and accepted for maintenance or stipulated by agreement for maintenance by the village of bourbonnais all other drainage facilities when located on other than public property shall be the responsibility of the owner of the property on which they exist or the owner of the drainage facility regardless of whether or not dedicated easements exist over said facilities b the permittee shall at all times properly operate and maintain all facilities and systems of treatment and control and related appurtenances which are installed or used by the permittee to achieve compliance with conditions of this permit maintenance plan shall be used to determine maintenance needs  41612 private drainage system maintenance the owner of any private drainage system shall maintain the system in accordance with removal of debris from pipes and structures  41612 open drainage channel maintenance every person owning or occupying property an open drainage channel passes shall keep and maintain that part of the drainage channel within the property free of trash debris excessive vegetation and other obstacles that would pollute contaminate or retard the flow of water drainage channel in addition the owner or occupant shall maintain existing privately owned structures adjacent to a drainage channel so that such structures will not become a hazard to the use function or physical integrity of the drainage channel physical modifications to the drainage channel other than those necessary to remove debris and other obstacles are prohibited without a grading and drainage permit and the other applicable permits  41612 ownership detention basins are owned and maintained by the property owner unless otherwise described by this article or indicated by the appropriate official property developers shall contact the appropriate official to inquire about the ownership and maintenance responsibility of existing regional detention basins which may affect the development  41612 detention basin maintenance and repair responsibilities a detention basins and associated inflow and outflow systems are maintained by the property owner absent any specific legal agreement to the contrary b maintenance agreements may be required at the option of the appropriate official to define parties responsible for the maintenance of detention basins c the detention basin owner shall be responsible for the following items 1 an annual report on the detention basin condition using the checklist provided in section 12140 shall be submitted to the appropriate official 2 at five year intervals the detention basin shall be inspected by a licensed professional engineer registered in the state of illinois a report of this inspection shall be submitted to the appropriate official within 60 days of the inspection the inspection shall include an evaluation of the items in the checklist included in section 12140 an annual report is not required the year the fiveyear report is due 3 detention basin owners shall notify subsequent owners of their maintenance responsibilities and transfer basin maintenance records to the party with active maintenance responsibility 4 these requirements shall be effective only for facilities constructed after the passage of this article  41612 maintenance considerations a it should be noted that many bmps require regular maintenance in order to function adequately throughout their design life design provisions shall be made to minimize longterm maintenance requirements in some situations specific bmps may be rejected if projected maintenance requirements cannot be met by the property owner or if the village of bourbonnais determines the proposed bmp is too cumbersome requires extensive maintenance or excess cost b the stormwater drainage system shall be designed to minimize and facilitate maintenance use of native vegetation is strongly encouraged to reduce maintenance increase wildlife habitat and to provide other benefits wet bottom detention basins shall be provided with alternate outflows which can be used to completely drain the pool for sediment removal where onsite topography allows pumping may be considered if drainage by gravity is not feasible presedimentation basins shall be included where feasible for localizing sediment deposition and removal site access for heavy equipment shall be provided c longterm maintenance also shall include the routine removal of trash debris and obstructions from the basin outlet structure periodic removal of accumulated sediment eg from swales and settling basins also shall be done to maintain the function and aesthetics of stormwater facilities at a minimum sediment shall be removed from trapping devices whenever one foot or more of sediment has accumulated in the basin bottom naturally landscaped areas of detention and drainage facilities shall be maintained via controlled burning every one to three years as needed to control invasive weeds where controlled burning is not feasible or allowed mowing andor selective herbicide applications shall be performed as needed on an annual basis all turfed areas shall be mowed on a regular basis to maintain grass height as established by the village of bourbonnais d a maintenance plan meeting the requirements of section 12108 shall be submitted to the village of bourbonnais prior to the issuance of a drainage and grading permit  41612 procedures for receipt and consideration of information by the public village of bourbonnais shall establish and publicize procedures for receipt and consideration of information regarding noncompliance of provisions in this article  41612 right of entry and sampling a whenever the appropriate official has cause to believe that there exists or potentially exists in or upon any premises any condition which constitutes a violation of this article the appropriate official shall have the right to enter the premises at any time to determine if the discharger is complying with all requirements of this article in the event that the owner or occupant refuses entry after a request to enter has been made the jurisdiction is hereby empowered to seek assistance from a court of competent jurisdiction in obtaining such entry b the appropriate official shall have the right to set up on the property of any discharger to the storm drainage system such devices that are necessary to conduct sampling of discharges  41612 notice of violation a whenever the appropriate official determines that a person has violated or failed to meet a requirement of this article said appropriate official will order compliance by written notice of violation to the responsible person and property owner posting the written notice on the property will constitute written notice a copy of the notice of violation will be mailed by ordinary mail to the address of the responsible person or property owner of record b the notice of violation shall include 1 the name of the responsible person and property owner 2 the date and location of the violation 3 a description of the violation 4 actions that must be taken by the responsible person to remedy the violation 5 the deadline within which the required actions must be completed 6 enforcement actions that may be taken by the jurisdiction 7 notice date 8 a statement that any person receiving a notice of violation may file a written appeal of the notice to the appropriate official within 15 days of the notice date the appropriate official will affirm modify or rescind the notice in writing within 15 days of the date of the appeal if the recipient of a notice of violation is dissatisfied with the outcome of the appeal to the appropriate official the appeal process outlined in section 1253 of this article will be followed  41612 action without notice of violation enforcement actions identified in this article can be made by the village of bourbonnais when necessary to stop an actual or threatened discharge that presents or may present imminent danger to the environment or property or to the health or welfare of persons or to the storm drainage system  41612 enforcement actions any person who fails to comply with or appeal a notice of violation or fails to comply with an appeal decision of the appropriate authority will be subject to one or more of the following enforcement actions 1 stop work order the appropriate official may issue a stop work order to the owner and contractors on a construction site by posting the order at the construction site and distributing the order to all jurisdiction departments whose decisions may affect any activity at the site unless express written exception is made the stop work order shall prohibit any further construction activity at the site and shall bar any further inspection or approval necessary to commence or continue construction or to assume occupancy at the site a notice of violation shall accompany the stop work order and shall define the compliance requirements 2 abatement of an illicit connection the appropriate official may order jurisdiction representatives to terminate an illicit connection any expense related to such abatement by jurisdiction representatives shall be fully reimbursed by the property owner 3 abatement of a violation on private property when a property owner is not available not able or not willing to correct a violation the appropriate official may order village representatives or agents to enter private property to take any and all measures necessary to abate the violation it shall be unlawful for any person owner agent or person in possession of any premises to refuse to allow village of bourbonnais representatives to enter upon the premises for these purposes any expense related to such abatement by village representatives shall be fully reimbursed by the property owner 4 recovery of costs within 30 days after abatement by jurisdiction representatives the appropriate official shall notify the property owner of the costs of abatement including administrative costs and the deadline for payment the property owner may appeal the recovery costs as outlined in section 1253 of this article 5 termination of utility services after lawful notice to the customer and property owner concerning the proposed disconnection the appropriate official shall have the authority to order the disconnection of jurisdiction water sanitary sewer andor sanitation services upon a finding by the village that the disconnection of utility services will remove a violation of this article that poses a public health hazard or environmental hazard 6 criminal prosecution any person who violates or continues to violate a prohibition or requirement of this article shall be liable to criminal prosecution to the fullest extent of the law and shall be subject to criminal penalties  41612 criminal penalties any person violating this article shall upon an adjudication of guilt or a plea of no contest be fined a maximum of $100000 each separate day on which a violation is committed or continues shall constitute a separate offense violations of this article by any person or entity shall be guilty of a petty offense  41612 other legal action notwithstanding any other criminal or civil remedies or procedures available to the village if any person violates this article the village of bourbonnais village attorney may commence an action for appropriate legal and equitable relief including damages and court costs the village attorney may seek an emergency preliminary or permanent injunction or both which restrains or compels the activities on the part of the discharger  41612 abrogation and greater restrictions this article is not intended to repeal abrogate or impair any existing easements covenants or deed restrictions where this article and other ordinance easements covenants or deed restrictions conflict or overlap whichever imposes the more stringent restrictions shall prevail  41612 separability the provisions and sections of this article shall be deemed separable and the invalidity of any portion of this article shall not affect the validity of the remainder  41612 implementation this article is effective upon passage with the following exceptions 1 subdivision improvements the requirements for obtaining a grading and drainage permit are waived if the preliminary plat of a subdivision was approved by the village prior to the passage of this article all other requirements of the article shall remain in effect 2 nonsubdivision improvements requiring a building permit the requirements for obtaining a grading and drainage permit for nonsubdivision related improvements requiring a building are waived for the duration of the building permit if the building permit was issued prior to the passage of this article all other requirements of the ordinance shall remain in effect 3 improvements that previously did not require a permit the requirements for obtaining a grading and drainage permit for construction that did not require a permit prior to passage of this article are waived for a period of one year if the construction commenced prior to the passage of this article all other requirements of the ordinance shall remain in effect  41612 variances and appeals village of bourbonnais after a public hearing may 1 determine and vary the requirements and regulations of this article in harmony with their general purpose and intent where the appropriate entity makes written findings of fact in accordance with the standards herein after prescribed and further find that there are practical difficulties or particular hardships in the way of carrying out the strict letter of requirements and regulations of this article 2 uphold modify or overrule the decision of the appropriate official 3 a written application for a variance from the requirements of this article or an appeal of a decision by the appropriate official shall be filed within 30 days of the time when a reasonably prudent person should have become aware of the need or when owner contractor lessee or operator was first made aware of the need for the variance or the decision of the appropriate official the application shall fully state the grounds of the request and the facts relied upon by the applicant said application for a variance shall be verified by an illinois licensed professional engineer each application shall be filed with the appropriate official or the building department the appropriate official will review and transmit recommendations to the planning commission which shall review such recommendations prior to granting or denying the variance minutes of the hearing process shall be recorded and written findings shall be made on each of the criteria and made public for all variance decisions and shall be filed with the village clerk the costs of the hearing shall be born by the applicant  41612 variances the village of bourbonnais shall not vary the requirements and regulations of this article unless evidence is presented that prove that 1 the land in question is of such shape or size or is affected by such physical conditions or is subject to such title limitations or record that it is impossible or impractical for the applicant to comply with all of the requirements of this article 2 the granting of the variance will not be detrimental to the public welfare environment or injurious to other property in the vicinity of the subject property and is unique to the subject site and not generally applicable to other properties in the village 3 the planning commission shall hold a public hearing on each application for variance within 30 days after receipt of the application for a variance the applicant of the variance shall notify all adjoining property owners by certified mail return receipt requested no later than five prior to the hearing date said notice shall include contact information the time date and place of the hearing and reason for the variance request the building department has the authority to require additional property owners to be notified if heshe deems it appropriate and necessary within 30 days after the public hearing the planning commission shall approve the variance with the conditions it deems necessary disapprove the variance or take other such action as appropriate 4 post construction site peak runoff rate control for sites discharging directly to the kankakee river are unnecessary because 1 no adverse flooding impacts would potentially be created by increased peak runoff rates along the conveyance between the project site and the river and 2 increased peak runoff rates will not potentially contribute to adverse ecological impacts including water quality degradation by either artificial or natural mechanisms or by stream erosion this exemption does not relieve the property owner from constructing and maintaining a sediment trapping bmp following illinois urban manual criteria during construction and a permanent detention facility meeting requirements in this article  41612 appeals village of bourbonnais shall consider each application for modification to the decision of the appropriate official at a public meeting within 30 days after the appeal application is received by the village within 30 days after the public meeting planning commission shall uphold modify or overrule the decision of the appropriate official  41612 secs 12541260  reserved article v  discharge control general requirements for all construction sites a owner responsibility the owner of a site with construction activity meeting the requirements of a grading and drainage permit shall be responsible for compliance with the requirements of this article b waste disposal solid waste industrial waste yard waste and any other pollutants or waste on any construction site shall be controlled use of bmps waste or recycling containers shall be provided and maintained by the owner or contractor on construction sites where there is the potential for release of waste uncontained waste that may blow wash or otherwise be released from the site is prohibited c readymixed concrete readymixed concrete or any materials resulting from the cleaning of vehicles or equipment containing or used in transporting or applying readymixed concrete shall be contained on construction sites for proper disposal release of these materials to any elements of the storm drainage system is prohibited d soil erosion and sediment control appropriate bmps such as silt fences diversions sediment traps or other appropriate sediment or runoff control measures shall be implemented to prevent the release of sediment from construction sites prior to the commencement of grading activities disturbed areas should be minimized disturbed soil shall be protected and stabilized and construction entrances shall be managed to prevent sediment tracking onto adjacent roadways sediment tracked onto public streets shall be removed immediately disturbed areas shall be stabilized with approved vegetative measures within 14 calendar days following the end of active disturbance or redisturbance all temporary soil erosion and sediment control bmps shall remain in place and be fully maintained until the establishment of permanent vegetation throughout the construction site at which time they shall be removed within 30 days consideration shall be given to environmentally sensitive areas based on slope soil type vegetation and proximity to a water body e continued compliance upon completion of permitted construction activity on any site the property owner and subsequent property owners will be responsible for continued compliance with the requirements of this article in the course of maintenance reconstruction or any other construction activity on the site f rights reserved village of bourbonnais reserves the right to require any nonagricultural construction development activity regardless of disturbed area or type of activity to comply with this article if it is determined to be the cause of or a contributor to an existing or potential erosion sediment or stormwater impact  41612 secs 12621270  reserved article vi  permits and plans permit exceptions a except as exempted below no person shall commence construction prior to obtaining the appropriate grading and drainage permit as defined below the building department will issue grading and drainage permits b in order to preclude inappropriate phasing of developments to circumvent the intent of this article when a proposed development activity will occur on a lot or parcel of land that has contiguous lots or parcels of lands owned by the same property owner then the criteria as defined in this section will be applied to the total land area compiled from aggregate ownership parcels c a grading and drainage permit shall not be required for the following 1 any construction activity below the minimum thresholds for a class 1 grading and drainage permit 2 agricultural practices including the implementation of conservation measures included in a farm conservation plan approved by the natural resources conservation service 3 construction of a singlefamily dwellings and duplex with a subdivision with an approved neighborhood drainage plan and swp3  41612 thresholds for class 1 grading and drainage permit all construction except singlefamily residential and duplexes that meets one of the following thresholds shall require a class 1 grading and drainage permit 1 any
