$50000    81902 secs 20152025  reserved article ii  chronic nuisance property division 1  generally property violation a any certain property within the village that becomes a chronic nuisance property is in violation of this article and is subject to its remedies b any person in charge who permits property under his or her ownership or control to be a public nuisance property shall be in violation of this article and subject to its remedies  4698 definitions chronic nuisance property chronic nuisance property shall be property upon which three or more of the behaviors listed below have occurred during any 60day period as a result of any three separate factual events that any law enforcement agency has investigated 1 disorderly conduct as defined in 720 ilcs 5261 2 unlawful use of weapons as defined in 720 ilcs 5241 et seq 3 mob action as defined in 720 ilcs 5251 4 discharge of a firearm as defined in 720 ilcs 52412 and 15 5 gambling as defined in 720 ilcs 5281 6 possession manufacture or delivery of controlled substances as defined in 720 ilcs 570401 et seq 7 assault or battery or any related offense as defined in 720 ilcs 5121 et seq 8 hosting an underage party where alcohol is presentserved andor illegal drugscontrolled substances are present 9 public indecency as defined in 720 ilcs 5119 10 prostitution as defined in 720 ilcs 51114 et seq 11 criminal damage to property as defined in 720 ilcs 5211 et seq 12 possession cultivation manufacture or delivery of cannabis as defined in 720 ilcs 5501 et seq 13 illegal consumption or possession of alcohol as defined in 235 ilcs 51 et seq 14 violation of the ordinances of the village relative to garbage  andor any adopted version of the property maintenance the ability to regulate restrain dominate counteract or governor conduct that occurs on that property owner any person agent firm or corporation having any legal or equitable interest in the property owner includes but is not limited to 1 a mortgagee in possession in whom is vested a all or part of the legal title to the property  or b all or part of the beneficial ownership and the right to the present use and enjoyment of the premises  or 2 an occupant who can control what occurs on the property permit to suffer allow consent to acquiesce by failure to prevent or expressly ascent or agree to the doing of an act person any natural person association partnership or corporation capable of owning or using property in the village person in charge any person in actual or constructive possession of a property including but not limited to an owner occupant of property under his or her domain ownership or control property any real property including land in that which is affixed incidental or pertinent to land including but not limited to any premises room house building or structure or any separate part or portion thereof whether permitted or not  4698   111615 remedy a in the event a court determines property to be a chronic nuisance property the court may order that the property be closed and secured against all use and occupancy for a period of not less than 30 days but not more than 180 days or the court may employ any other remedy deemed by it to be appropriated to abate the nuisance b in addition to the remedy provided in subsection a above the court may impose upon the owner of the property a civil penalty in the amount up to $10000 per day payable to the village of bourbonnais for each day the owner had actual knowledge that the property was a public nuisance property and permitted the property to remain a public nuisance property c in determining what remedy or remedies shall be employed the court may consider evidence of other conduct that has occurred on the property including but limited to 1 the disturbance of neighbors 2 the recurrence of loud and obnoxious noises 3 repeated consumption of alcohol in public  4698 exemptions notwithstanding any other provisions within this chapter and consistent with the terms and conditions of 65 ilcs 51215 no property shall be considered a chronic nuisance if the police investigations described arise from calls for assistance from any victim of domestic abuse or person with a disability additionally no victim of domestic abuse or person with a disability shall be evicted sanctioned or punished in any way resulting from his or her seeking public assistance or police protection relating to that abuse or condition however nothing herein shall prevent the enforcement of this code against an owner of the property who may be a victim of domestic abuse or be disabled but whose victimhood or disability is unrelated to the law enforcement activity causing the property to be a chronic nuisance  111615 secs 20302035  reserved division 2  abatement procedures action to abate the corporate counsel of the village or the states attorney of kankakee county may commence an action to abate public nuisances as described above upon being satisfied by affidavits or other sworn evidence that an alleged public nuisance exists the court may without notice or bond enter a temporary restraining order or a preliminary injunction to enjoin any defendant from maintaining such nuisance and may enter an order restraining any defendant from removing or interfering with all property used in connection with the public nuisance  4698 procedure a when the chief of police of the village receives two or more police reports documenting the occurrence of nuisance activity on or within a property the chief of police shall independently review such reports to determine whether they describe criminal acts upon such findings the chief may 1 notify the person in charge in writing that the property is in danger of becoming a chronic nuisance property the notice shall contain the following information a the street address or legal description sufficient for identification of the property  b a statement that the chief of police has information that the property may be a chronic nuisance property with a concise description of the nuisance activities that may exist or that have occurred the chief of police shall offer the person in charge an opportunity to propose a course of action that the chief of police agrees will abate the nuisance activities leading to the violation  c demand that the person in charge respond to the chief of police within ten days to discuss the nuisance activities b after complying with the notification procedures described herein when the chief of police receives a police report documenting the occurrence of a third nuisance activity at or within a property and determines that the property has become a chronic nuisance property the chief of police shall 1 notify the person in charge in writing that the property has been determined to be a chronic nuisance property the notice shall contain the following information a the street address or legal description sufficient for identification of the property  b a statement that the chief of police has determined the property to be a chronic nuisance property with a concise description of the nuisance activities leading to his or her findings  c demand that the person in charge respond within ten days to the chief of police and propose a course of action that the chief of police agrees will abate the nuisance activities leading to the violation  d service shall be made either personally or by first class mail postage prepaid return receipt requested addressed to the person in charge at the address of the property believed to be a chronic nuisance property or such other place that is likely to give the person in charge notice of the determination by the chief of police  e a copy of the notice shall be served on the owner at such address as shown on the tax rolls of the county in which the property is located andor the occupant at the address of the property if these persons are different from the person in charge and shall be made either personally or by first class mail postage prepaid  f a copy of the notice shall also be posted at the property after ten 10 days has elapsed from the service or mailing of the notice to the person in charge and the person in charge has not contacted the chief of police  g the failure of any person to receive notice that the property may be a chronic nuisance property shall not invalidate or otherwise affect the proceedings under this article 2 if after the notification but prior to the commencement of legal proceedings by the village pursuant to this article a person in charge stipulates with the chief of police that the person in charge will pursue a course of action the parties agree will abate the nuisance activities giving rise to the violation the chief of police may agree to postpone legal proceedings for a period of not less than ten nor more than 30 days except in the case of a nuisance activity under section 3 b7 subsection 2027a7 where a search warrant was executed at the property if the agreed course of action does not result in the abatement of the nuisance activity or if no agreement concerning abatement is reached within 30 days the chief of police shall request authorization for the corporate counsel to commence a legal proceeding to abate the nuisance  3 concurrent with the notification procedures set forth herein the chief of police shall send copies of the notice as well as any other documentation which supports legal proceedings to the corporate counsel c when a person in charge makes a response to the chief of police as required above any conduct or statements made in connection with the furnishing of that response shall not constitute an admission that any nuisance activities have or are occurring this subsection does not require the exclusion of any evidence that is otherwise admissible or offered for any other purpose  4698 commencement of action burden of proof a in an action seeking closure of the chronic nuisance property the village shall have the initial burden of showing by a preponderance of the evidence that the property is a chronic nuisance property b it is a defense to an action seeking the closure of a chronic nuisance property that the owner of the property at the time in question could not in the exercise of reasonable care of diligence determine that the property had become a public nuisance property or could not in spite of the exercise of reasonable care and diligence control the conduct leading of the findings that the property is a chronic nuisance property c in establishing the amount of any civil penalty requested the court may consider any of the following factors if they need be found appropriate and shall site those found applicable 1 the actions or lack of action taken by the person in charge to mitigate or correct the problem at the property  2 whether the problem at the property was repeated or continuous  3 the magnitude or gravity of the problem  4 the cooperation of the person in charge with the village  5 the cost of the village investigating and correcting or attempting to correct the condition  4698 emergency closing procedures a in the event that it is determined that the property is an immediate threat to the public safety and welfare the village may apply to the court for such interim relief as is deemed by the chief of police to be appropriate in such an event the notification provision set forth in section 2029 above need not be complied with however the village shall make a diligent effort to notify the person in charge prior to a court hearing b in the event that the court finds the property constitutes a chronic nuisance property as defined in this section 2031 section 2027 the court may order the remedy set out above in addition in the event that it also finds the person in charge had knowledge of activities or conditions of the property constituting or violating this article and permitted the activities to occur the court may assess a civil fine as provided above c the court may authorize the village to physically secure the property against use of occupancy in the event the owner fails to do so within the time specified by court in the event that the village is authorized to secure the property all costs reasonably incurred by the village to affect a closure shall be made and assessed as a lien against the property if used herein costs mean these costs actually incurred by the village for the physical securing of the property as well as tenant relocation costs d the company affecting the closure shall prepare a statement of cost and the village shall thereafter submit said statement to the court for its review if no objection of the statement is made within the period described by the court a lien in said amount may be recorded against said property e any person who is assessed the cost of closure andor civil penalty by the court shall be personally liable for the payment thereof by the village shall mean and include any explosive composition or any substance or combination of substances or article prepared for the purpose of producing a visible or audible effect of a temporary exhibitional nature by explosion combustion deflagration or detonation and shall include blank cartridges toy cannons in which explosives are used the type of balloons which require fire underneath to propel the same firecrackers torpedoes skyrockets roman candles bombs or other fireworks of like construction and any fireworks containing any explosive compound or any tablets or other device containing any explosive substance or containing combustible substances producing visual effects provided however that the term fireworks shall not include snake or glow worm pellets  smoke devices  trick noisemakers known as party poppers booby traps snappers trick matches cigarette loads and auto burglar alarms  sparklers  toy pistols toy canes toy guns or other devices in which paper or plastic caps containing twentyfive hundredths grains or less of explosive compound are used providing they are so constructed that the hand cannot come in contact with the cap when in place for the explosion  and toy pistol paper or plastic caps which contain less than twenty hundredths grains of explosive mixture  the sale and use of which shall be permitted at all times b sale use or explosion of fireworks prohibited except as hereinafter provided it shall be unlawful for any person firm copartnership corporation or other entity to knowingly possess offer for sale expose for sale sell at retail or use or explode any fireworks c exception the village shall be exempted from this restriction for the purpose of conducting supervised public displays of fireworks  provided however that every such display shall be handled by a competent individual and shall be of such a character and so located discharged or fired as not to be hazardous to property or endanger any person or persons d permits the corporation authorities shall have the power to grant permits for supervised public displays of fireworks every such display shall be handled by a competent individual designated by the local authorities herein specified and shall be of such a character and so located discharged or fired as not to be hazardous to property or endanger any person or persons application for permits shall be made in writing at least 15 days in advance of the date of the display and action shall be taken on such application within 48 hours after such application is made after such privilege shall have been granted sales possession use and distribution of fireworks for such display shall be lawful for that purpose only no permit granted hereunder shall be transferable the applicant shall provide a bond in a sum not less than $100000 conditioned on compliance with the provisions of this law and the regulations of the state fire marshal adopted hereunder such permit shall be issued only after inspection of the display site by the issuing officer to determine that such display shall not be hazardous to property or endanger any person or persons forms for such application and permit may be obtained from the office of the state fire marshal one copy of such permit shall be on file with the issuing officer and one copy forwarded to the office of the state fire marshal the applicant shall also indemnify the village its officers officials employees and independent contractors against any damages associated with the issuance of the permit and the applicants use of the fireworks and anything related thereto the applicants acceptance of the permit shall be deemed to accept the legal requirement to indemnify the village its officers officials employees and independent contractors against any damages associated with the issuance of the permit and the applicants use of the fireworks and anything related thereto e certificates of registration possession by any party holding a certificate of registration under the fireworks regulation act of illinois filed  or by any employee or agent of such party or by any person transporting fireworks for such party shall not be a violation provided such possession is within the scope of business of the fireworks plant registered under that act  6203 littering a definitions  as used in this section unless the context otherwise this section environment any area air water or land accessible to the general public environment specifically excludes areas inside plant or facility boundaries where public access is restricted public or the environment to such material release does not include proper application of fertilizers or pesticides for the purposes of gardening or farming or the discharge or emission of hazardous materials pursuant to state or federal permit or other authority  required any person who owns leases operates or controls any facilities or equipment for the use storage handling transportation or manufacture of a hazardous material or his agent or employee shall give notice by telephone to the police of the village of bourbonnais whenever as a direct result of an incident or accident which involves the actual or potential release of a hazardous material any of the following occur towit 1 a member of the general public is killed or receives injuries requiring hospitalization  2 fire breakage or spill of any hazardous material within the village  3 there is a release of any hazardous material into the environment  4 a container of a hazardous material has been damaged to the point of showing physical evidence of a release  5 a motor vehicle containing a hazardous material has overturned on or off a public highway within the village  12087 time of notification the notification economic development commission established there is hereby established a commission on economic development hereinafter referred to as the commission for the village of bourbonnais  121586 membership a composition the commission shall consist of five voting members who shall be appointed by the president with the consent of the board of trustees of the village of bourbonnais b residency requirement the members appointed as heretofore provided shall all be residents of the village of bourbonnais at the time of their appointment c term the members of the commission shall serve for terms of four years except as hereinafter provided the members initially appointed to the commission shall by lottery draw staggered terms ranging from one to four years  121586 exofficio member the president of the village shall appoint one member of the board of trustees who shall serve as an exofficio member of the commission and shall report to the president and board of trustees on a monthly basis regarding the activities of the commission  121586 clerk the commission may identify one officer or employee of the village to serve as clerk of the commission in order to superintend the affairs of the commission and to ensure the orderly process of business before the commission  121586 duties the commission shall undertake the following duties 1 to prepare a comprehensive economic development plan for submission to the president and board of trustees of the village of bourbonnais 2 to coordinate a marketing program for and on behalf of the village of bourbonnais in order to retain existing industrial commercial and service enterprises and to encourage the location of such enterprises within the corporate boundaries 3 to review all applications for industrial development bonds and to forward specific findings on each application to the president and board of trustees for action 4 to set forth specific development incentives that can be applied to particular development projects and to recommend the application of such incentives on selected projects to the president and board of trustees 5 to work in concert with the plan commission the zoning board of appeals and other public bodies in the furtherance of the objectives of the local economic development plan 6 to cooperate with all public and private agencies in the county of kankakee and state of illinois engaged in economic development activities 7 to identify public and private funding sources to support economic development activities and with the consent of the president and board of trustees to make application for funding from such sources 8 to conduct commercial industrial and service enterprise retention activities 9 to encourage existing commercial industrial and service facilities within the village of bourbonnais conduct of recognition programs 10 to undertake such other activities as are deemed appropriate necessary and within the scope of the commissions authority  121586 actions not binding all actions of the commission shall be advisory in nature and shall not bind the village of bourbonnais  121586 funding the commission shall be afforded such funding under appointment all proposed auxiliary policemen shall be fingerprinted and their fingerprints shall be checked with the federal bureau of investigation washington dc for any possible criminal record no person shall be appointed as an auxiliary policeman if he has been convicted of a felony or any crime involving moral turpitude the appointment of any or all auxiliary policemen may be determined by the village president subject to the advice and consent of the village board qualifications restrictions and direction such auxiliary policemen shall not be members of the regular police department of the village auxiliary policemen shall be either residents of the village or residents of bourbonnais township kankakee county illinois identification symbols worn by such auxiliary policemen shall be different and distinct from those used by the regular police department and shall be elected and chosen by the chief of police auxiliary policemen shall at all times during the performance of their duties be subject to the direction and control of the chief of police  101689 training required auxiliary policemen prior to entering upon any of their duties shall receive a course of training in the use of weapons and other police procedures by the chief of police such course of training shall include not less than 40 hours of firearms training and not less than 40 hours of classroom instruction the course must include a presentation of the ethical moral and legal consideration to be taken into account by any person who uses a firearm upon completion of the course of training the chief of police shall file a certificate attesting to the auxiliary policemens completion of such course with the village clerk  101689 compensation for court appearance auxiliary policemen shall be paid at civil disorder 4 to perform normal and regular police duties when assigned by the chief of police on occasions when it is impractical for members of the regular police department to perform normal and regular police duties 5 to arrest or cause to be arrested without process all persons who break the peace or are found violating any village or any criminal law of the state 6 to commit arrested persons for examination 7 if necessary to detain arrested persons in custody overnight or sunday in any safe place or until they can be brought before the proper officer 8 to serve and execute all warrants for the violation of village or the state criminal law within the limits of the village 9 without limiting the generality of the proceeding powers and duties auxiliary police officers shall stat ch 38  851 et seq  mass gatherings ch 11112  901 et seq short title this article shall be known as the bourbonnais public demonstration   declaration of purpose it is declared to be the public policy of this village 1 that the maintenance of good order on roadways as defined in this is a paramount responsibility of democratic government  and 2 that the public health welfare and safety of the community require that the movement of vehicular traffic on such roadways be unlawfully conducted with a minimum of disruption  and 3 that the practice of unhindered or unrestrained picketing or demonstrating on such roadways has caused disruption of police fire and emergency services and injury to persons regardless of participation in the march assembly or demonstration  and 4 that the practice of multiple demonstrations on the same day in different locations has unreasonably deprived the citizens of police fire and emergency services  and 5 that the provisions herein enacted are necessary for the protection of the health welfare and safety of the public  permission required it is unlawful for any person group or organization to conduct or participate in any march assembly meeting or gathering on roadways in more than one specific area of or location in the village on any given day unless it is acting with permission of the chief of police  advance notice required it is maximum number of persons participating and the names and addresses of the organizers of any such march assembly meeting or gathering its route and its time of inception and duration at least 24 hours before such inception  number of participants limited it is unlawful for any group or organization or any individual acting with such group or organization to conduct or participate in any march assembly meeting or gathering on roadways unless such march assembly meeting or gathering is limited to such numbers as in the opinion of the chief of police will not obstruct pedestrian or vehicular traffic in an unreasonable manner the chief of police shall within 12 hours of receiving the notice required by section 2934 inform the group or organization as to the limitation on number of persons allowed to participate  hours of restriction it is unlawful for any group organization or any individual to conduct or participate in any march assembly meeting or gathering on roadways during peak shall be known and may be cited and referred to as the subdivision the village of bourbonnais illinois  61206 official status this chapter is hereby made a part of the official plan of the village  61206 intent and purpose this chapter is adopted for the following purposes 1 to insure sound harmonious subdivision development and community growth and to safeguard the interests of the homeowner the subdivider the investor and the village 2 to provide permanent assets to the locality and to the village 3 to prevent scattered development beyond existing public utilities and prevent excessive development costs 4 to assure the development of land for the highest possible use with all the necessary protection against deterioration and obsolescence 5 to provide common grounds of understanding and a sound working relationship between the village and the developer  61206 application of regulations no person shall subdivide any tract of land which is located within the village or in any unincorporated area which is located entirely or in part within one and onehalf miles of the nearest limits of the village except in conformity with the provisions of this chapter the subdivision plans and plats proposed improvements to be installed and all procedures relating thereto shall in all respects be in full compliance with the regulations herein the provisions of this chapter shall also apply to all planned developments whether residential commercial or otherwise in nature and to any other developments whether a subdivision is required or not under the law statutes ordinances or regulations of the governmental body or agency having jurisdiction regardless of whether the same is labeled a subdivision or not it being the intent of this ordinance to apply to all types of development both within the village and to areas lying within one and onehalf miles of the corporate limits of the village  61206 general provisions a whenever any subdivision of land shall hereafter be laid out within the incorporated limits of the village or within territory not more than one and onehalf miles beyond the incorporated boundary of the village provided such territory is not included in any other municipality the subdivider thereof or his agent shall submit both a preliminary and final subdivision plat to the plan commissioners for their approval the subdivision plats and all procedures relating thereto shall in all respects be in full compliance with these regulations the developer shall submit a time schedule of activities as well as a timetable for completion of the project to the plan commission 1 no final engineering shall be approved until the preliminary plat for the subdivision is approved 2 no work may be laid out or improvements made to the natural land until the final engineering has been approved and a site development permit granted for work within the village and within oneandonehalf miles thereof that is under the jurisdiction of other local or state agencies ie idot kankakee county etc the developer shall provide the village with three copies of applicable and approved site development permit 3 no final plat shall be approved until the final engineering is approved and a site development permit is granted application for a site development permit shall be accompanied by a bond pursuant to subsection 307a4 herein that guarantees the improvements shall be completed in one year and shall not fail for one year following village acceptance and final inspection of the improvements b until plats and plans for the subdivision are approved 1 no land shall be subdivided nor any street laid out nor any improvements made to the natural land 2 no lot tract or parcel of land within any subdivision shall be offered for sale nor shall any sale contract for sale or option be made or given 3 no improvements such as sidewalks water supply stormwater drainage sanitary sewerage facilities gas service electric service lighting grading paving or surfacing of streets shall hereafter be made by any owner or owners or his or their agent or by any public service corporation at the request of such owner or owners or his or their agent 4 there shall be no final approval unless the final storm sewer and sanitary sewer laterals water lines curbs and base course are in and lot elevations established within four inches c all offerings or dedications of land to the village for use as streets highways alleys schools parks playgrounds or other public uses shall be referred to the plan commission for review and recommendation before being accepted by the village board or by any other governing authority of the village d where a tract of land proposed for subdivision is part of a larger logical subdivision unit in relation to the village as a whole the plan commission may before approval cause to be prepared a plan for the entire area or neighborhood such plan to be used by the plan commission as an aid in judging the proposed plat the village engineer shall cooperate with the plan commission in the preparation of this plan and shall furnish such surveys and data as may be necessary e whenever an area is subdivided into lots of 30000 square feet or more and there are indications that such lots will eventually be resubdivided into smaller building lots consideration shall be given to the street and lot arrangement of the original subdivision so that additional minor streets can be located which will permit a logical arrangement of smaller lots f interpretation 1 in their interpretation and application the provisions of this chapter shall be held to be the minimum requirements 2 where the conditions imposed by any provision of this chapter upon the use of land are either more restrictive or less restrictive than comparable conditions imposed by any other provision of this chapter or of any other law ordinance resolution rule or regulation of any kind the regulations which are more restrictive or which impose higher standards or requirements shall govern 3 this chapter is not intended to abrogate any easement covenant or any other private agreement provided that where the regulations of this chapter are more restrictive or impose higher standards or requirements than such easements covenants or other private agreements the requirements of this chapter shall govern 4 if any section subsection sentence clause phrase or portion of this chapter is for any reason held invalid or unconstitutional by any court of competent jurisdiction such portion shall be deemed a separate distinct and independent provision and such holding shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions thereof g the developer shall be required to meet all architectural and engineering obligations imposed by state and federal law including but not limited to any requirements imposed by the americans with disabilities act ada in the event that the requirements of state andor federal law differ from this chapter the stricter requirements must be met  61206 rules and definitions in an interpretation of this chapter the rules and definitions contained in this section shall be observed and applied except when the context clearly indicates otherwise a rules 1 words used in the present tense shall include the future  and words used in the singular number shall include the plural number and the plural number the singular 2 the word shall is mandatory and not discretionary 3 the word may is permissive 4 the word lot shall include the words plot piece and parcel 5 the phrase used for shall include the phrases arranged for designed for intended for maintained for and occupied for b definitions alley a public rightofway primarily for vehicular traffic along the side or in the rear of properties which affords only a secondary means of access to abutting properties applicant the person or persons responsible for preparing and recording the plats of the subdivision and for carrying out all appropriate requirements relating thereto as outlined in this chapter avenue an area which primarily serves or is intended to serve as a vehicular and pedestrian access to abutting lands or to other streets or avenues the word avenue refers to rightofway or easement running in a northsouth direction in the village bituminous base course bbc bituminous base course material shall conform to specification as specified in section 355 of the standard specification for road and bridge construction adopted by the state of illinois department of transportation block a tract of land bounded by streets or by a combination of streets and public parks cemeteries railroad rightsofway bulkhead lines or shorelines of waterways or corporate boundary lines of the village boulevard any primary or secondary thoroughfare meeting standards and specifications of the village which is shown on the subdivision plat and is or is to be dedicated for public use running in any direction in the village building any structure designed built or intended for the shelter enclosure or protection of persons animals chattels or movable property of any kind building setback line a line within a lot or other parcel of land which determines the area on the land where the erection of a building or accessory building is prohibited the area between the building setback line and the adjacent boundary of the street which the lot abuts is the area on which the erection of a building or accessory building is prohibited crosswalk a public rightofway located across a block to provide pedestrian access to adjacent streets or areas culdesac a minor street having one open end and being permanently terminated by a vehicle turnaround developer the persons having site control over real estate being subdivided to erect any structure or to install any improvements on a tract of land or to undertake any activities such as grading in preparation therefor easement a grant by a property owner for the use of a strip of land by the general public a corporation or a certain person or persons for a specific purpose or purposes highway a rightofway for vehicular traffic which traverses a nonurban area usually a state or federal numbered route lot a portion of a subdivision or other parcel of land intended for transfer of ownership or for building development outlot a tract or portion of land in a subdivision or other parcels of land authorized or granted for use for one or more specific purposes intended as a unit whether for immediate or future development the lot shall be reserved and recorded as an outlot parkway a route intended to be used primarily by passenger vehicles and whose rightofway is or is intended to be developed in a parklike character pavements see roadway plan commission the advisory body that provides initial review of sketch plans preliminary plats and final plats  they are an advisory body to the village board the village board will take final action on all three recommendations plat a plan map drawing or chart on which the subdividers plan for the subdivision of land is presented and which he submits for approval and intends to record in final form plat final the drawings and documents presented for final approval and as described in subsection 307c plat preliminary the drawings and documents presented for final approval and as described in subsection 307b roadway the paved area within a street rightofway intended for vehicular traffic including all curb and gutter facilities street an area which primarily serves or is intended to serve as a vehicular and pedestrian access to abutting lands or to other streets the word street refers to the rightofway or easement avenue highway road boulevard lane drive or thoroughfare whether public or private running in an east and west direction in the village and not to the roadway or paving or other improvement within the street rightofway street approved any street whether public or private meeting standards and specifications of the village street private and public access a minor street which is adjacent to highways and primary thoroughfares and which provides access to abutting properties and protection to local traffic from fast moving traffic on the highways and primary thoroughfares street minor a street intended primarily as access to abutting properties street private any street which is under the jurisdiction of an individual corporation or trustee or any street which is privately owned or established street public any primary or secondary thoroughfare or minor street which is shown on the subdivision plat and is or is to be dedicated for public use subdivider the title holders of real estate which is being subdivided subdivision the division of land into two or more parts any of which is less than five acres for the purpose whether immediate or future of transfer of ownership or building development including all public streets alleys ways for public service facilities parks playgrounds school grounds or public grounds and all the tracts parcels lots or blocks and numbering all such lots blocks or parcels by progressive numbers giving their precise dimensions  provided however that the following shall not be considered a subdivision and shall be exempt from the requirements of this chapter 1 the division or subdivision of land into parcels or tracts of five acres or more in size which does not involve any new streets or easements of access  2 reserved  3 the sale or exchange of parcels of land between owners of adjoining and contiguous land  4 the conveyance of parcels of land or interests therein for use as rightofway for railroads or other public utility facilities which does not involve any new streets or easements of access  5 the conveyance of land owned by a railroad or other public utility which does not involve any new streets or easements of access  6 the conveyance of land for highway or other public purposes or grants or conveyances relating to the dedication of land for public use or instruments relating to the vacation of land impressed with a public use  7 conveyances made to correct descriptions in prior conveyances  8 the sale or exchange of parcels or tracts of land existing on  into no more than two parts and not involving any new streets or easements of access notwithstanding the above no diminishment in the land area of an existing lot of record shall be permitted if the resulting diminishment results in any lot becoming nonconforming in size area length or width for the zoning district in which it is located moreover no residential lot of record shall be reduced in size area length or width to an amount less than the average size area length or width of the two adjoining residential lots on the respective side yard of lots located on the same street side as the lot in question thoroughfare primary a street of considerable continuity which serves or is intended to serve as a principal traffic artery between the various sections of the bourbonnais area and is so designated as a primary thoroughfare on the general development plan thoroughfare secondary a street which carries traffic from minor streets to the primary thoroughfare system or between primary thoroughfares and is so designated as a secondary thoroughfare on the general development plan village board the village board has the legal authority to approve sketch plans preliminary plats and final plats of subdivisions after recommendations have been made by the plan commission  61206 procedure for approval a general 1 sketch plans a the developersubdivider shall schedule a preapplication meeting with the village before preparing the preliminary plat in order to become thoroughly familiar with any regulations or conditions affecting the territory and the goals and objectives of the villages plan b following a meeting with village staff the developersubdivider may submit said plans to the plan commission for additional review and comments the plan commission may provide general comments regarding a sketch plan submitted by subdivider the plan commission does not approve or deny sketch plans sketch plans are considered for informational purposes only 2 fees and costs a all applications for development or subdivision shall be accompanied by a nonrefundable application fee in the amount as hereinafter set forth in section 3014 herein b no plan shall be forwarded to the planning commission for review without this fee having first been paid payment of the fee is in no way contingent on whether the plat of development or subdivision submitted is approved or disapproved in addition the applicant shall submit as part of their application evidence of title or other information demonstrating that they have a valid contract or option to purchase the land for which the application is made or is the owner of record for that land c all costs incurred by the village for review of plans and specifications inspection of construction improvements as may be required and any costs as incurred by the village engineer village attorney and other individuals as may be needed shall be paid first by the village and reimbursed to the village by the developersubdivider d cash escrow prior to commencement of public improvements the developer shall provide to the village a cash escrow to be held in a noninterestbearing account by the village and shall be returned to the applicant upon acceptance by the village of the public improvements as required herein and submittal of asbuilt plans as further required herein the amount of the cash escrow shall be the lesser of one percent of the estimated cost of improvements as verified by the villages engineer or $20000 per lot created but in no case shall the amount of the escrow be less than $500000 3 completion of public improvements a a site development permit is required prior to beginning construction of public improvements application for a site development permit shall be accompanied by a guarantee the improvements shall be completed in one year and shall not fail for one year following village acceptance and final inspection of the improvements as specified in subsections 1 4 herein b all public improvements required under the provisions of this chapter to be provided at the subdividersdevelopers expense and shall be fully completed within one year after receipt of a site development permit in accordance with the final plans and specifications approved by the villages engineer c all contracts for the construction of public improvements shall be subject upon request to review and approval by the village engineer prior to the commencement of construction and all such contracts shall contain contractors warranties of material and workmanship in form and substance approved by the village engineer all contracts for construction shall include a requirement that contractor maintain during the course of construction allrisk builders risk insurance which names the contractor subdivider developer village of bourbonnais the villages engineer and their officers employees and agents as additional insured d at all times during the progress of construction of the public improvements the subdivider shall permit the village village engineer and their duly authorized representatives to observe any portion thereof if the village engineer shall determine that the improvements or any portions thereof are not being constructed in accordance with the final plans and specifications previously approved by the village engineer the village administrator or his duly authorized representative shall have the right with notice to the owner to stop the work of any contractor the work shall not be resumed until the contractor shall receive written authorization from the village administrator for the resumption of the work e the developer or the contractor shall notify the village administrator or appointee and village engineer at least 48 hours before construction is to begin or end this provision shall apply also to the resumption of construction after a break of three days or more and to the temporary halting of construction as for holidays or vacations significant changes in the construction schedule shall be reported to the village engineer f the village engineer shall be notified when the following work is completed 1 road subgrade is completed and ready for proof roll a aggregate road in place to grade ready for proof roll before curbs are installed b aggregate road base is in place to grade and ready for proof roll before curbs are installed all utility crossings are to be inspected before trench backfill to ensure illinois environmental protection agency requirements are adhered to 2 all utilities are to be inspected before the trench backfill is installed to ensure illinois environmental protection agency requirements are adhered to 3 curbs are completed aggregate road base is in place and ready for inspection before binder is installed 4 sanitary and storm sewer manholes are installed and grouted 5 final backfilling and grading are complete g the obligation of the subdividerdeveloper to provide public improvements shall include without limitation the furnishing of all necessary surveys engineering drawings working drawings determination of grade and location communications with contractors review and approval of periodic payment estimates collection of lien waivers and all other services customarily performed by a registered professional engineer and licensed surveyor providing general supervision of such work and the village shall have no liability or responsibility for such services h during the construction phase of the subdivision and prior to acceptance by the village of the public improvements the subdividerdeveloper shall maintain in good condition and restore all existing public improvements to prevent material deterioration thereof and to assure that no imminent hazard to life or property within the subdivision or areas adjacent thereto shall exist in the event the subdivider fails to properly maintain or restore existing public improvements as required herein the village may upon ten days written notice to the subdivider perform or have performed on its behalf any maintenance or restoration work reasonably necessary to assure that material deterioration of existing public improvements will not occur in the event it is determined by the village administrator or his duly authorized representative that failure of the subdividerdeveloper to properly maintain or restore existing public improvements will result in imminent hazard to life or property within the subdivision or in areas adjacent thereto the village may without prior notice to the subdividerdeveloper perform or have performed on its behalf any maintenance or restoration work reasonably necessary to prevent such hazards within ten days thereafter the subdivider shall be notified in writing by the village administrator of the performance of such work by the village and the cost thereof in the event that the maintenance or restoration work is performed by or on behalf of the village the village may withdraw the security required by this chapter in an amount equal to the cost of that work plus ten percent thereof for administrative purposes i upon completion of the public improvements required under the provisions of this chapter the subdividerdeveloper shall file with the village engineer a certificate certified by a registered professional engineer licensed to practice engineering in the state of illinois to the effect that all such public improvements have been substantially completed in accordance with the final plans and specifications approved by the village engineer in addition the subdivider shall furnish to the village engineer three complete sets of asbuilt plans and one electronic copy on cd in autocad or comparable format as recommended by the village engineer the neighborhood drainage plan sheet shall be signed and certified as provided in this chapter upon receipt of the plans the village engineer shall forward one complete set to the village department of public works one complete set to the village department of building standards and shall retain one set for his own files j if the public improvements have been completed within one year from the receipt of a site development permit the owner or subdivider has filed the certificate and asbuilt engineering plans required herein the village engineer shall make a site visit and observe the public improvements if he determines that the public improvements are in conformance with the asbuilt engineering plans approved plans and all codes and ordinances of the village the village engineer shall forward to the village administrator his recommendation that the public improvements to be approved and accepted by the village board as satisfactory within 30 days following receipt of such recommendation the village board shall approve and accept the public improvements and shall authorize the village administrator to release or refund to the depositor thereof the guarantee for the public improvements provided pursuant to the regulations herein however the village shall hold the additional ten percent guarantee in escrow for a period of one year k if the subdividerdeveloper shall fail to complete all the required public improvements or shall fail to complete the improvements in conformance with the approved final plans and specifications within one year from receipt of a site development permit the village may withdraw all funds provided as security pursuant to the provisions herein and may utilize those funds to cause the performance of any work necessary to complete the public improvements or to bring them into conformance with the approved final plans and specifications codes or ordinances of the village the subdivider shall be obligated to reimburse the village for any costs incurred in excess of those funds in order to complete the required public improvements l approval of the preliminary or final plat by the village board shall not constitute an acceptance of any dedicated streets and improvements for maintenance purposes irrespective of any act or acts by any officer agent or employee of the village with respect to those streets and improvements for maintenance purposes shall be made only by the adoption of a resolution by the village board after there has been filed with the village clerk a certificate or letter by the village administrator and village engineer certifying that all improvements required to be constructed or installed in connection with the approval of the final plat of subdivision or development have been fully completed and the construction or installation thereof has been approved by the village engineer m special requirements for bituminous pavement the following qualifications and requirements shall apply to bituminous pavements regardless of design methods used 1 no construction required by this section shall be permitted after november 1 without written authorization of the village engineer 2 in new construction the final asphalt surface shall not be installed until at least 80 percent of the lots in the phase currently being constructed have been developed or for a period of at least one year from construction of the roadway whichever shall occur first the final asphalt surface shall not be installed until inspected by village engineer and the developer has repaired failed bituminous concrete binder course n television inspection all public sanitary and storm sewers shall be internally video taped by remote camera tapes shall be in color of vhs or dvd format and submitted with written reports to the village engineer for his review and approval prior to acceptance of the sewer improvements by the village 4 acceptance of streets and improvements final approval of a plat by the village board shall not constitute an acceptance of any dedicated streets and improvements for maintenance purposes irrespective of any act or acts by any officer agent or employee of the village with respect to those streets or improvements final acceptance of all streets and improvements for maintenance purposes shall be made only by the adoption of a resolution by the village board after there has been filed with the village clerk a certificate or letter by the village administrator and village engineer certifying that all improvements required to be constructed or installed in connection with the approval of the final plat of subdivision or development have been fully completed and the construction or installation thereof has been approved by the village engineer 5 guarantee of public improvements a the owner or developersubdivider shall guarantee the public improvements for a period of one year from the date the village board accepts those improvements during this oneyear period the owner or developersubdivider shall be obligated upon written notice from the village administrator as provided herein to repair or reconstruct any public improvement or portion thereof which may deteriorate fail or otherwise cease to meet the standards established by the engineers certificate or asbuilt plans provided that ordinary maintenance shall not be the obligation of the owner or developersubdivider b the village administrator shall provide written notice to the owner or developersubdivider of deterioration of public improvements specifying a time period in which the deterioration is to be remedied  and the owner or developersubdivider shall perform the necessary repair or reconstruction at his own expense within the time specified c in the event that it is determined by the village administrator or his authorized representative that failure of the owner or developersubdivider to restore existing public improvements will result in imminent hazard to life or property within the development or subdivision or in areas adjacent thereto the village may without prior written notice to the owner or developersubdivider perform or have performed on its behalf any restoration work reasonably necessary to prevent that hazard within ten days thereafter the owner or developersubdivider shall be notified in writing by the village administrator of the performance of the work and of the cost thereof d to secure the performance of the obligations imposed by this section the owner or developersubdivider shall provide to the village a performance bond issued by a surety authorized to do business in the state in an amount equal to 110 percent of the village engineers written estimate of the total cost of the public improvements this bond is to expire no earlier than one year after the village boards acceptance of the public improvements e in the event that during the oneyear guarantee period the owner or developersubdivider shall fail to repair reconstruct or otherwise remedy conditions of deterioration of public improvement in the development or subdivision within the time specified in the villages written notice of those conditions or shall fail to reimburse the village for the cost of emergency restoration performed by or on behalf of the village pursuant to this section within 30 days of receiving notice of such cost the village may file a claim against the bond required herein for performance of the obligation by the surety 6 restriction on issuance of building permits no building permits shall be issued to erect a structure on property within the village limits until that property has been subdivided in compliance with this chapter no building permit shall be issued to erect a structure on any subdivided property within the village which property is being resubdivided until a that property has been resubdivided in compliance with this chapter  b a development permit has been granted by the building department  c the lot corners have been clearly marked  and d adequate survey benchmarks have been set for foundation location surveyor certification however at the discretion of the village administrator a building permit for any structure to be erected on any lot in the subdivision may be denied until such time as the subdivider shall have completed such public improvements as are determined by the village engineer to be necessary to provide reasonable access adequate drainage and proper water and sanitary sewage facilities to serve the lot on which the structure is built 7 enforcement no plat of any subdivision on any development plan shall be entitled to be recorded in the recorders office or have any validity until it has been approved in a manner prescribed by this chapter 8 procedure for conditional approval of preliminary plat a on reaching conclusions informally as recommended in paragraph a2 above regarding his general program and objectives the subdividerdeveloper shall cause to be prepared a preliminary plat b fourteen fullsize copies and ten reduced copies 11  17 of the preliminary plat shall be submitted along with a written application for approval at least 21 days prior to the meeting at which it is to be considered three of the fullsize copies shall be accompanied by the documents and data required in this chapter these copies documents and data are to be distributed to the village administrator or his designee the village attorney and the village engineer c the first meeting with the plan commission may be considered a workshop the subdivider will be allowed to deliver a short presentation at the workshop the plan commission will provide comments to the subdivider and may provide copies of comments provided by the villages staff and others the plan commission will often table consideration of the preliminary plat at this first meeting to give the subdivider opportunity to address various comments d following review of the preliminary plat and other data submitted in compliance with these regulations and following negotiations with the subdivider on changes deemed advisable and the kind and extent of improvement to be made by him the plan commission shall within 60 days or at the first regularly scheduled meeting after resubmittal act on the preliminary plat and data as submitted or modified the plan commission shall express its decision as a recommendation to the village board and state the conditions of such recommendation if any e following recommendation by the plan commission and following negotiations with the subdivider on changes deemed advisable and the kind and extent of improvement to be made by him the village board shall within 30 days act on the preliminary plat and data as submitted or modified and if approved the village board shall express its approval and state the conditions of such approval if any or if disapproved the village board shall express its disapproval and its reasons therefor f approval of a preliminary plat shall not constitute approval of the final plat rather it shall be deemed an expression of approval to the layout submitted on the preliminary plat as a guide to the preparation of the final plans and specifications and the final plat b procedure for approval of final plans and specifications four copies of the final plans and specifications along with all supporting documentation shall be submitted to the village for distribution to the public works department building department and the village administrator  one complete set of final plans and specifications along with all supporting documentation shall be delivered directly to the village engineer the village engineer shall provide written comments to the subdividersdevelopers design engineer for consideration the final plans and specifications shall not be approved until they conform to the approved preliminary plat village codes and ordinances and accepted engineering practices and copies of all other applicable agency permits have been received by the village engineer the village engineer shall be copied on all agency correspondence throughout the permitting process c procedure for approval of final plat 1 the final plat shall conform substantially to the preliminary plat as approved and if desired by the applicant it may constitute only that portion of the approved preliminary plat which he proposed to record and develop at the time provided however that such portion conforms to all requirements of these regulations and phasing indicated on the preliminary plat 2 fourteen fullsize copies and ten reduced copies 11  17 of the final plat shall be submitted to the plan commission along with a written application for approval at least 15 days prior to the meeting at which it is to be considered three of the fullsize copies shall be accompanied by the required conditions covenants and restrictions and other documents required to be recorded with the final plat these copies and documents are to be distributed to the village administrator or his designee village attorney and village engineer 3 the final plat and other exhibits required for approval shall be prepared and shall be submitted to the plan commission within two years after approval of the preliminary plat  otherwise such approval shall become null and void unless application for an extension of time is made to and granted by the village board 4 the final plat submitted to the plan commission for approval shall be accompanied by a letter from the village engineer approving the final engineering specifications and supporting documentation and a certificate by the subdividerdeveloper and the subdividersdevelopers engineer disclosing and detailing all revisions of the preliminary plat it shall be the duty of the developer to make a complete if the plan commission approves it shall affix its seal upon the plat together with the certifying signature of its chairman and secretary if it disapproves it shall set forth its reasons in its own records and provide the applicant with a copy 6 filing a after approval of the final plat by the plan commission and the fulfillment of the requirements of these regulations 12 copies of the final accompanied by one of the following 1 a certificate by the village engineer that all improvements and installations to the subdivision required for its approval have been made or installed in iv specify the time for the completion of the improvements and installations the time limit for completion shall be no longer than one year from the date of final plat approval by the village v any canceled without the prior consent of the village b it shall not require the consent of the ownerapplicant prior to any draw on it by the village provided it may require a certification under oath by days and if it has not been renewed and if any applicable obligation of the ownerapplicant for which it is security remains uncompleted or unsatisfactory then the village may call and draw down the letter of credit and thereafter either hold all proceeds as security for the satisfactory completion of the obligations or employ the proceeds to complete the obligations and reimburse the village for any and all costs and expenses including without limitation legal fees village engineers fees and administrative costs incurred by the village as the village shall determine d upon approval by the village board receipt of a site development permit and signing by the village president the developer shall record the plat with the county recorder of kankakee county within four months if not streets 1 all streets shall be considered in their relation to existing and planned streets to topographical conditions to public convenience and safety and to the proposed uses of the land to be served by such streets 2 where such is not shown on the general development plan the arrangement of streets in a subdivision shall either a provide for the continuation or appropriate projection of existing principal streets in surrounding areas  or b conform to a plan for the area or neighborhood approved or adopted by the plan commission to meet a particular situation where topographical or other conditions make continuance or conformance to existing streets impracticable 3 minor streets shall be so laid out that their use by will be discouraged 4 where a subdivision abuts or contains an existing or proposed highway or primary thoroughfare as shown on the general development plan the plan commission may require marginal access streets  reverse frontage with screen planting contained in a nonaccess reservation at least ten feet wide along the rear property line  deep lots with rear service alleys  or such other treatment as may be necessary for adequate protection of residential properties and to afford separation of local traffic 5 where a subdivision borders on or contains a railroad or highway the plan commission may require a street approximately parallel to and on each side of such railroad or highway at a distance suitable for the appropriate use of the intervening land as for park purposes in residential districts or for commercial or industrial purposes in appropriate districts such distances shall also be determined with due regard for the requirements of approach grades and future grade separations 6 reserve strips controlling access to streets or alleys shall be prohibited 7 all street intersections and confluences should encourage safe traffic flow 8 street jogs with centerline offsets of less than 125 feet shall be avoided 9 tangents shall be introduced between reverse horizontal curves on all streets see minimum standards for street design herein 10 when connecting street lines deflect from each other at any one point by more than ten degrees they shall be connected by a curve with a radius adequate to insure clear sight distances see minimum standards for street design herein 11 streets shall be laid out so as to intersect as nearly as possible at right angles and no street shall intersect any other street at less than 60 degrees 12 property lines at street intersections shall be rounded with a radius as specified in minimum standards for street design herein the plan commission may permit comparable cutoffs or chords in place of rounded corners 13 street rightofway widths shall be as specified in minimum standards for street design herein 14 half streets shall be prohibited except where essential to the reasonable development of the subdivision in conformity with the other requirements of these regulations and where the plan commission finds it will be practicable to require the dedication of the other half when the adjoining property is subdivided wherever a half street is adjacent to a tract to be subdivided the other half of the street shall be platted within such tract 15 deadend streets culdesacs designed to be so permanently shall not be longer than 500 feet from the intersection of the origin center of the circle to the end of the rightofway and shall be provided at the closed end with a turnaround having an outside pavement diameter of at least 80 feet and a street property line diameter of at least 112 feet 16 no street names shall be used which will duplicate or be confused with the names of existing streets existing street names shall be projected wherever possible street names shall be subject to the approval of the plan commission 17 street gradients and vertical curves shall be as specified in minimum standards for street design herein 18 street grades shall provide proper relation between the street and the first floor elevation of the houses or buildings and permit convenient and economical access to and drainage of the lots 19 in addition to meeting these minimum design standards all roadways shall meet or exceed aashto standards development standardsminimum standards for street designs expressway arterial major collector
